titleStmt.title: Description of Torah, megilot ṿe-hafṭarot (תורה, מגילות והפטרות)

notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pentateuch with Targum Onḳelos, the Five Scrolls and Hafṭarot, with punctuation and accents.

msItem.title: Torah, megilot ṿe-hafṭarot תורה, מגילות והפטרות

collation.p: 42 quires: 41 of 8 leaves and the last one of 7 leaves. Quires marked by ornamented catchwords on the last page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square script, provided with vowel-points and accents, of the 13th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown leather, blind-tooled, with clasps. Spine: 'Bible. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 9400.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Adam Clarke (b. 1762, d. 1832), Wesleyan Methodist minister and scholar. His bookplate with Greek inscription: ho theos agape estin (inner lower cover) and his short description of the manuscript in English on folio [ii verso]. This codex, together with nine other manuscripts (Add MS 9398-9407), was acquired by the British Museum in 1834, once the property of the Hagen family and then of Adam Clarke.
